content:
I have seen the message One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size. in doc-gen before, and often it makes sense when I see that message. It surprises me that carleson#MeasureTheory.HasStrongType also shows this message, even though it is a 1-liner in the source. Surely it has complicated implicit arguments, but doc-gen doesn't print those anyway.
Is this definition particularly tricky?

The equations get filtered rather primitively like this: https://github.com/leanprover/doc-gen4/blob/1b0072fea2aa6a0ef8ef8b506ec5223b184cb4d0/DocGen4/Output/Definition.lean#L26C1-L26C85 in particular the docstring here is relevant^^ https://github.com/leanprover/doc-gen4/blob/1b0072fea2aa6a0ef8ef8b506ec5223b184cb4d0/DocGen4/Output/Definition.lean#L11-L12
Measuring the equation by the length of its generated HTML seems rather strange
That is obviously true but it was just the simplest thing to do
Note that the "length of its generated HTML" part is also wrong, it's about the length of the text that will be shown by the HTML
